entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character in the story, referred to as 'I' and 'me'. He is evacuating from Hogsmeade with Ron and Hermione.

entities.name: potter
entities.description: A pub where Harry has had hundreds of kids running through it. It is also referred to as 'my pub' by Aberforth.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: The main antagonist in the story, who is attacking because Harry hasn't been handed over to him.

entities.name: aberforth
entities.description: Aberforth Dumbledore, the brother of Albus Dumbledore. He is mentioned as saying that keeping Slytherins hostage would have been a good idea.

entities.name: hogsmeade
entities.description: The village where Harry and his friends are evacuating from.

entities.name: slytherin
entities.description: A house at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Aberforth suggests keeping some Slytherins hostage.

entities.name: death eater
entities.description: A group of followers of Voldemort. Harry's friends have sent some Death Eaters to safety.

entities.name: snape
entities.description: Severus Snape, a teacher at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Dumbledore defended him for so long.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Albus Dumbledore, the headmaster of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Harry thinks that he would never have held students hostage.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: One of Harry's best friends, who is evacuating with him and Hermione.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: One of Harry's best friends, who is evacuating with him and Ron.

relationships.description: Aberforth suggests that keeping some Slytherins hostage would have been a good idea, but Harry disagrees.
Voldemort is attacking because he wants to capture Harry.
Aberforth refers to Potter as 'my pub'.
Harry thinks that Dumbledore would never have held students hostage, unlike Aberforth.
Ron and Hermione are evacuating together with Harry.
